meanings.definition: Comparative form of 'mince': thinner or more slender in form or figure.
meanings.sent1: She admired the mincier model on the runway.
meanings.sent2: The ballerina had a mincier physique than the gymnast.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to squeeze into the mincier box, but got stuck halfway.
meanings.sent4: Her mincier silhouette glided gracefully through the crowd.
meanings.sent5: The mincier branches of the tree swayed delicately in the breeze.

meanings.definition: Comparative form of 'mince': to cut or chop into very small pieces.
meanings.sent1: She needed to mincier the garlic for the pasta sauce.
meanings.sent2: The chef decided to mincier the vegetables for the stir-fry.
meanings.sent3: He attempted to mincier the huge watermelon with a tiny knife.
meanings.sent4: The blender minciered the ingredients into a smooth puree.
meanings.sent5: The butcher used a sharp knife to mincier the meat for the stew.

meanings.definition: Comparative form of 'mince': to walk with short, quick steps in an affectedly dainty manner.
meanings.sent1: She liked to mincier around the room in her new heels.
meanings.sent2: The princess would mincier into the ballroom with grace.
meanings.sent3: He tried to mincier across the muddy path but ended up slipping.
meanings.sent4: The dancer minciered across the stage, captivating the audience.
meanings.sent5: The little girl loved to mincier around the house pretending to be a fairy.
